title: Are All Spanish Doctors Male? Evaluating Gender Bias in German Machine Translation
author: Michelle Kappl (Technische Universität Berlin)
relevance_why: The paper addresses gender bias in machine translation systems, which can inform bias assessments and fairness in AI models used in audio and speech applications.
field: Social and Economic Aspects of ML-Fairness
background: Evaluating bias in machine translation involves analyzing how well systems preserve gender representations while translating text between languages.
contribution: The paper introduces the WinoMTDE dataset to evaluate gender bias in German machine translation, revealing systemic biases across various models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous evaluations largely focused on English-language machine translation systems, limiting insights into other languages.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work extends gender bias evaluation methods to German, utilizing specific German labor statistics for a more tailored assessment of biases in occupational contexts.

key_innovation: Developing a dataset that balances gender representations while incorporating occupational stereotypes allows for a nuanced analysis of translation errors related to gender bias.
real_world_impact: The results underscore the need for improved machine translation systems that reduce gender bias, which could lead to better representation of women in various professions in translations used in real-world applications.
limitations: The dataset size is small, and the stereotype annotations were conducted by a single individual, which may introduce some bias.

new_terms.gender bias: **Gender bias** refers to the unequal treatment of individuals based on their gender, often leading to skewed perceptions and representations in various contexts.
new_terms.WinoMTDE: **WinoMTDE** is a gender bias evaluation test set for German machine translation that assesses how well systems translate gendered occupational terms while considering societal stereotypes.

open_sourcing: The dataset and evaluation code are publicly available at https://github.com/michellekappl/mt_gender_german
